answers.answer: I am a 31 year old female  who has had back problems for years. It started in my back and then pain started shooting down my right leg, it was the most horrible pain in the world.  I was diagnosed with a bulging disc and sciatica.  I dealt with the pain for almost 2 years and then one day my right foot went numb and i got what the call foot drop.  I was admitted into the hospital where they found the disc had ruptured, discs usually rupture to one side or the other  mine went straight back, compressing my spinal cord.  I lost all feeling from the waist down including bladder and bowel. So i know what your going through and i feel for you.

question: Well I'm sorry if someone may have posted something like this before but I wouldn't mind some advice.2 years ago I was sent to the ER with very severe lower back pain. The hospital sent me home with painkillers and Valium and told me I was holding stress in that area of my back and that is what was causing the pain. I undertook a much less stressful lifestyle however things have gotten worse.6 months ago and over the course of about 12 weeks I lost all sensation in my bladder. I am now unable to tell when my bladder is full and was prone to wetting myself however have gotten into a routine of going to the bathroom every 2nd hour and sitting for a few minutes. Over this time I began losing sensation in my genitals and much to my own embarrasment can rarely reach climax anymore. I have also experienced about a 50% loss of feeling down the left side of my body. What may be a sharp scratch on my right side which will cause me to flinch feels much less painful on my left side. My back pain has also worsened to the point where I now cannot walk more than a few hundred metres without ending up in severe pain. I get bloating/swelling in my left leg so badly that I often cannot put my shoes on as my foot won't fit in them.I am a 27 year old female, 5'10, 225lbs (down from 240, have switched to a healthier diet), mild asthmatic, was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes about 2 1/2 years ago which is diet controlled and I am VERY mindful about what I eat the amount of sugar I ingest. I gave up smoking a month ago, probably have 1-2 glasses of wine a month and do not take any recreational drugs.My GP referred me to have a CT scan which showed some slight narrowing in L5/S1 however nothing that can explain my symptoms. I have seen a Neurosurgeon who has referred me for a full spine and a brain MRI. My Neurosurgeon confuses me as he doesn't explain things very well and I feel somewhat left in the dark about what the problem 'might' be.
